title: State Street Stock Has Crumbled, but CEO Ron O’Hanley Bought Up Shares
text:
State Street stock continues to slump, setting a multiyear low last month, but President and CEO Ron O’Hanley just made his first open-market purchase of the investing giant’s shares.

Barron’s said the selloff in State Street stock (ticker: STT) looked overdone a year ago, when shares were down 14% to $84.21. But shares continued to fall, ending 2018 with a 35.4% drop. So far in 2019 they are down another 17.8% through Friday’s close. By comparison, the Financial Select Sector SPDR ETF (XLF), of which State Street is a component,...
description: State Street CEO Ron O’Hanley made his first open-market purchase of the investing giant’s shares shortly after State Street stock tumbled to a six-year low.
